alert.note: Alert for Kankakee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 23 at 2:31PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Illinois... Kankakee River at Momence affecting Kankakee County. For the Kankakee River...including Momence...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of rain, snowmelt, and river ice is possible. * WHERE...Kankakee River from IL/IN state line downstream to confluence with Iroquois River at Aroma Park, including the Momence gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Low-lying wetlands, forest land, park land, and agricultural land along the river may flood. Roadways along the river may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 3.5 feet. River gauge data and river ice spotter reports indicated an ice jam from near Kankakee to near Sun River Terrace. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above bankfull later this week and may near flood stage. Shifting of river ice may occur which would cause rapid fluctuations in water levels. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. River ice may also cause gauge observations to be inaccurate. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 845 AM CST.
